result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Aaron Grotjahn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or any time he does not meet that requirement defendant must complete 9 hours community service per week.

Any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
AODA w/ follow up as recommended.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Aaron Grotjahn

records.addlTxt: DEOJ agreement

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 1:26pm
State appears by ADA K.Mayo.  Def appears in person and with Atty Corey Mehlos.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW; DEJ agreement.

State moves to:
16CF58 - Ct. 2 (Manuf/Deliver Sched I/II Narcotics)>>D&RI
16CF58 - Ct. 3 (Poss Narcotics)>>D&RI
16CF58 - Ct. 4 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA:
16CF58 - Ct. 1 (Poss w/Intent/THC)>>NO CONTEST
16CF58 - Ct. 5 (Poss Para)>>NO CONTEST
16CM142 - Ct. 1 (Poss THC)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis & def guilty on 16CF58-Ct. 5, and 16CM142-Ct. 1

COURT ORDERS: 
16CF58 - Ct. 1>>  COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 2 years for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct. 1 in 16CF58
DEOJ RH>> 8/20/18 at 8:30am
Bond continues in that case/count.

16CF58 - Ct. 5 and 16CM142 - Ct. 1>> Sentence W/held on each count; 1 year probation on each count, concurrent.
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; Absolute sobriety; AODA and any follow up as recommended; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or any time he does not meet that requirement, defendant must complete 9 hours of C.S. per week; CC; DNA sample and surcharge.
COURT allows expungement of above cases if defendant successfully completes DEJ in 16CF58 Count 1

>>4 days credit if revoked

Adj: 1:44pm
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
to Judge Strasser from Atty. Mehlos - includes 16CF58 & 16CM142
